Argentina

Wine

Argentina is the world’s fifth largest wine producer (behind France, Italy, Spain and the U.S.) . The area of Mendoza is far and away the most significant wine producing region of the country. Its high desert climate stands for intense sunshine but cooler air temperatures. There is very little rainfall, but no shortage of water thanks to proximity to the Andes mountains. Parkers confirms Argentina is on the rise and that recent vintages have been superb. Its white wines are famous for being delicious and thirst-quenching. Primarily Chardonnays and Sauvignon Blancs and Torrontes, which is indigenous to Argentina, are made. Among the reds, Malbecs from Argentina are magnificent on a level of quality unparalleled anywhere else in the world. Cabernet Sauvignon, and Bonarda, originally from Italy, where ripening is an issue, are also very important.
